codes.description:
The transaction failed permantently. The server will not try to send the message again. This is used as a general error code, so there are many reasons why you could be seeing it.

It’s common for email service providers to add a status code (5.1.1) after the SMTP reply code (smtp;550) for additional categorization of the issue.

responses.response: smtp;554 Email rejected due to security policies - https://community.mimecast.com/docs/DOC-1369#554 [#]

codes.description:
The transaction failed permantently. The server will not try to send the message again. This is used as a general error code, so there are many reasons why you could be seeing it.

It’s common for email service providers to add a status code (5.1.1) after the SMTP reply code (smtp;550) for additional categorization of the issue.

responses.response: smtp;550 Rejected by header based Anti-Spoofing policy: email@example.com - https://community.mimecast.com/docs/DOC-1369#550 [#]
smtp;550 Rejected by header based manually Blocked Senders: email@example.com - https://community.mimecast.com/docs/DOC-1369#550 [#]
